text: this fried chicken recipe has been
specially engineered so that you can
take it on a picnic and it'll keep its
crunch I marinated the chicken overnight
in a buttermilk brine so buttermilk lots
of salt and then lots of spices because
buttermilk is tenderizing what it does
is that the acids help the chicken flesh
soften a little bit and then you get a
really tender fried chicken
after the chicken soaked in the marinade
you want to dredge it and just basically
season flour a little salt some chili
and some cayenne and that's what's gonna
give it its crunch normally after you
dredge chicken and in the flour mixture
you can fry it right away but for this
recipe I wanted to double dredge so I'm
gonna dredge them up again and then you
can do the frying I think the biggest
mistake that people make when they're
frying chicken is if you don't get the
oil hot enough it's really important to
make sure your oil has reached 350 it
needs to be very hot before you add the
chicken a very classic way to fry
chicken is to put it in a Dutch oven
instead of a skillet and to cover it
halfway through the cooking it's almost
like a little bit of a pressure cooker
because you have the steam and you have
the oil and it cooks it a lot more
quickly and a lot more evenly it's kind
of tough to test for doneness with fried
chicken because you can't really take
its temperature wallets in the oil so
what should happen is the crust should
get nice and brown and the inside should
be cooked through just take a piece out
and cut into it and make sure that you
don't see any red juices you want the
juices to run clear that's your best bet
